snippet: New York City has embraced unusual technology to reduce overflows of raw sewage into New York Harbor during a major rainfall: two inflatable dams costing $15.7 million.
abstract: New York City has embraced several technologies to reduce overflows of raw sewage into New York Harbor during a major rainfall, including two inflatable dams costing $15.7 million; together, they are expected to save about 100 million gallons of sewage each year from flowing untreated into the harbor.
lead_paragraph: New York City has embraced unusual technology to reduce overflows of raw sewage into New York Harbor during a major rainfall: two inflatable dams costing $15.7 million.

headline.print_headline: In the Bowels of the City, Blocking Wastewater Overflows
headline.seo: In Bowels of New York City, Inflatable Dams Help Block Wastewater Overflow
headline.main: In the Bowels of the City, Blocking Wastewater Overflows
